subject: Career
title: The XYZ Formula
description: A micro-lesson that makes The XYZ Formula usable.

hook.text: Google's recruiters teach a formula: 'Accomplished X, as measured by Y, by doing Z.'

buildup.text: It forces you to include three things: the result, the evidence, and the method.

discovery.text: 'Reduced churn 18% (Y) by redesigning the onboarding flow (Z)' â€” clear, credible, specific.

twist.text: Most bullets fail because they only have Z â€” what you did â€” without X or Y.

climax.text: When you can't find Y, ask: what would have happened if I hadn't done this?

punchline.text: What you did matters less than what changed.

quiz.question: What does Google's XYZ resume formula stand for?
options: Accomplished X, measured by Y, by doing Z
